definition: (of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level)/to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall
to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
(fig.) to be astounded

sentences.english: The moving average was last breached in July.
sentences.chinese: 移动平均线最近跌破关口还是在7月。

sentences.english: When oil broke through $90 [a barrel], the selling clearly exacerbated.
sentences.chinese: 过去当油价跌破每桶90美元时，抛售明显加剧。

sentences.english: The wild-card player surprised everyone by winning the championship.
sentences.chinese: 那位外卡选手跌破众人的眼镜，赢得了冠军。

sentences.english: The red-chip bubble ultimately burst， with most now trading at below their issue prices.
sentences.chinese: 红筹泡沫最终爆破，大部分红筹股都跌破招股价。

sentences.english: He should know; his approval rating has dipped below 30%.
sentences.chinese: 他对此应该有所体会，他的支持率已经跌破了30%。

sentences.english: Chinese equities plummeted below 3100 points Friday as fears mounted over the fallout from Dubai's massive debt problems.
sentences.chinese: 受迪拜债务危机影响，沪指27日跌破3100点。

sentences.english: If Apple proves me wrong, I’ll be shocked.
sentences.chinese: 要是苹果用实际行动证明我错了，我可要跌破眼镜了。

sentences.english: A sustain decline below Monday's low of 1240 will trigger the next sell signal.
sentences.chinese: 如果持续跌破周一低点1240点，将触发卖出信号。

sentences.english: Ali:I fell and banged my nose.
sentences.chinese: 我摔了一跤，跌破了鼻子。

definition: to fall/to tumble
to fall back (of water level or share prices)
large fall
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
to fall to
to go down/to decline
bull market (prices appear to be rising)
market close
stock market index/share price index/abbr. for 股票指數|股票指数[gu3 piao4 zhi3 shu4]
tendency/trend/path
(economics) to slump/steep fall (in value etc)
short term
Shanghai Stock Exchange (SSE), abbr. for 上海證券交易所|上海证券交易所[Shang4 hai3 Zheng4 quan4 Jiao1 yi4 suo3]
lowest point/minimum (point)
